result.execSummary:
The defendant Heather S. Charnas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Drug Paraphernalia. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Taylor County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: The forfeiture and costs are to be paid at the rate of $25.00 a month beginning 30 days after release from custody.  Defendant is to keep the Clerk of Court's office informed of her current address upon release from custody.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Heather S. Charnas

Defendant Heather S. Charnas in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Defendant Heather S. Charnas in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties have reached an agrement. Statement moves to amend to a county ordinance.  Plea of no contest to the amended charge of possession of drug paraphernalia.      Court finds defendant guilty and orders a forfeiture in the amount of $263.50 plus $67.00 surcharge.   Payments are stayed until 30 days after release from custody.  Payments are to be $25.00 a month beginning 30 days after release from custody.    - rt
Status conference on May 9, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

Defendant Heather S. Charnas in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Defendant Heather S. Charnas in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waive reading of complaint, charges and penalties.  Plea of not guilty to all charges.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 29, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  - rt

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.  Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Heather S. Charnas in court, in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court quashes a warrant.   Attorney Tlusty requests a $500.00 signature bond; booking; no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Notice of right to an attorney given to defendant.  Initial appearance scheduled for February 23, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Per TC Jail, DE in custody.
